item.text: When Solomon finished praying, fire came down from heaven and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices, and the Lord’s splendor filled the temple.
The priests were unable to enter the Lord’s temple because the Lord’s splendor filled the Lord’s temple.

When all the Israelites saw the fire come down and the Lord’s splendor over the temple, they got on their knees with their faces downward toward the pavement. They worshiped and gave thanks to the Lord, saying, “Certainly he is good; certainly his loyal love endures!”
The king and all the people were presenting sacrifices to the Lord.

<st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="02076 02077">sacrificed</st> <st data-num="06242 08147 0505">22,000</st> <st data-num="01241" class="">cattle</st> and <st data-num="03967 06242 0505">120,000</st> <st data-num="06629" class="">sheep</st>. Then the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="02596" class="">dedicated</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God’s</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st>.

The priests stood in their assigned spots, along with the Levites who had the musical instruments used for praising the Lord. (These were the ones King David made for giving thanks to the Lord and which were used by David when he offered praise, saying, “Certainly his loyal love endures.”) Opposite the Levites, the priests were blowing the trumpets, while all Israel stood there.

Solomon consecrated the middle of the courtyard that is in front of the Lord’s temple. He offered burnt sacrifices, grain offerings, and the fat from the peace offerings there because the bronze altar that Solomon had made was too small to hold all these offerings.

This <st data-num="01419 03966">great</st> <st data-num="06951" class="">assembly</st> included people from <st data-num="0935" class="">Lebo</st> <st data-num="02574" class="">Hamath</st> in the north <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="05158" class="">Stream</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st> in the south.<n id="1" />

On the <st data-num="08066" class="">eighth</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> they <st data-num="06213" class="">held</st> an <st data-num="06116" class="">assembly</st>, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> they had <st data-num="02598 06213">dedicated</st> the <st data-num="04196" class="">altar</st> for <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> and celebrated the <st data-num="02282" class="">festival</st> for <st data-num="07651" class="">seven</st> more <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st>.
On the twenty-third day of the seventh month, Solomon sent the people home. They left happy and contented because of the good the Lord had done for David, Solomon, and his people Israel.
After Solomon finished building the Lord’s temple and the royal palace and accomplished all his plans for the Lord’s temple and his royal palace,
the Lord appeared to Solomon at night and said to him: “I have answered your prayer and chosen this place to be my temple where sacrifices are to be made.

if my <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>, <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="07121" class="">belong</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> <st data-num="08034" class="">me</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03665" class="">humble</st> themselves, <st data-num="06419" class="">pray</st>, <st data-num="01245" class="">seek</st> to please <st data-num="06440" class="">me</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="07725" class="">repudiate</st> their <st data-num="07451" class="">sinful</st> <st data-num="01870" class="">practices</st>,<n id="3" /> then <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> will <st data-num="08085" class="">respond</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> <st data-num="08064" class="">heaven</st>, <st data-num="05545" class="">forgive</st> their <st data-num="02403" class="">sin</st>, and <st data-num="07495" class="">heal</st> their <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>.<n id="5" />

<st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st> I have <st data-num="0977" class="">chosen</st> and <st data-num="06942" class="">consecrated</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01004" class="">temple</st> by <st data-num="01961" class="">making</st> it my <st data-num="05704 05769">permanent</st> <st data-num="08034 08033">home</st>;<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05869 03820">I</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> <st data-num="03605 03117">constantly</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">present</st> <st data-num="08033" class="">there</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="0859" class="">You</st> <st data-num="0518" class="">must</st> <st data-num="01980 06440">serve</st> me <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> your <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">did</st>. <st data-num="06213" class="">Do</st> <st data-num="03605 0834">everything</st> I <st data-num="06680" class="">commanded</st> and <st data-num="08104" class="">obey</st> my <st data-num="02706" class="">rules</st> and <st data-num="04941" class="">regulations</st>.<n id="1" />
Then I will establish your dynasty, just as I promised your father David, ‘You will not fail to have a successor ruling over Israel.’
“But if you people ever turn away from me, fail to obey the regulations and rules I instructed you to keep, and decide to serve and worship other gods,

then I will <st data-num="05428" class="">remove</st> you<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> my <st data-num="0127 0834">land</st> I have <st data-num="05414" class="">given</st> you,<n id="2" /> I will <st data-num="07993 05921 06440">abandon</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01004 0834">temple</st> I have <st data-num="06942" class="">consecrated</st> with my <st data-num="08034" class="">presence</st>,<n id="3" /> and I will <st data-num="05414" class="">make</st> you<n id="4" /> an <st data-num="04912 08148">object of</st> <st data-num="04912" class="">mockery</st> and <st data-num="08148" class="">ridicule</st><n id="5" /> among <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">nations</st>.
As for this temple, which was once majestic, everyone who passes by it will be shocked and say, ‘Why did the Lord do this to this land and this temple?’

Others will then answer, ‘Because they abandoned the Lord God of their ancestors, who led them out of Egypt. They embraced other gods whom they worshiped and served. That is why he brought all this disaster down on them.’”
